clusters.title: Obama backs Newsom's redistricting plan in California
clusters.neutral_headline: Obama Supports Newsom's Redistricting Plan in California

items.title: Obama backs Newsom's redistricting plan in California
items.standfirst: Former President Barack Obama is backing California’s plan to counter mid-decade redistricting efforts by Republicans in Texas.
items.content: Former President Barack Obama is backing California’s plan to counter mid-decade redistricting efforts by Republicans in Texas.

items.title: Obama backs California effort to redraw districts in response to Texas
items.standfirst: The former president saluted Gavin Newsom’s “measured approach” that could net Democrats five seats.
items.content: Former President Barack Obama is supporting California’s mid-cycle redistricting effort as a “responsible approach” to Republicans drawing new maps in Texas. Obama praised California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s ballot measure proposal to redraw congressional districts and tilt at least five congressional districts in the state towards Democrats at a fundraiser on Tuesday for the National Democratic Redistricting Committee. “I believe that Governor Newsom’s approach is a responsible approach,” he said, according to excerpts obtained by POLITICO. “I think that approach is a smart, measured approach, designed to address a very particular problem in a very particular moment in time.” California Democrats are expected this week to allow voters to bypass an independent commission established by voters and decide whether to approve the new partisan maps for the next three election cycles in response to the Republican’s move in Texas. Obama’s remarks comes as both parties in California gear up for what is expected to be a hard-fought campaign over the ballot initiative to redraw political boundaries in the state in response to President Donald Trump’s efforts to keep the House in Republican hands in the 2026 midterms. The former president said redrawing the lines is “not my preference,” but that the Democratic-led effort in California is “responsible” in this context. “We cannot unilaterally allow one of the two major parties to rig the game,” he said. “And California is one of the states that has the capacity to offset a large state like Texas.” The Associated Press first reported Obama’s remarks. Obama said he hopes that the NDRC and national Democrats will work to eliminate partisan gerrymandering as a “long-term goal,” but applauded Newsom’s response to the new Texas maps and Trump’s broader campaign to push other red states to draw new, more favorable maps. “Given that Texas is taking direction from a partisan White House that is effectively saying: gerrymander for partisan purposes so we can maintain the House despite our unpopular policies, redistrict right in the middle of a decade between censuses — which is not how the system was designed; I have tremendous respect for how Governor Newsom has approached this,” he said. Newsom thanked Obama for his support in a social media post and promised that California’s redistricting proposal will “neutralize any attempts Donald Trump makes to steal Congressional seats.”

ai_summary: Barack Obama is backing California's redistricting plan.
The plan aims to counter mid-decade redistricting efforts.
Republicans in Texas are involved in redistricting efforts.
Obama saluted Gavin Newsom's "measured approach".
The plan could net Democrats five seats.

items.title: Texas redraws congressional map: Stakes high for 2026 midterms
items.standfirst: Texas state representatives have approved a new congressional map that could help Republicans gain five seats in the 2026 midterms. While redistricting itself isn’t unusual, FRANCE 24s Kethevane Gorjestani notes this year’s plan is controversial for its timing and because it was explicitly requested by President Donald Trump, making the process unusually political.
items.content: Texas state representatives have approved a new congressional map that could help Republicans gain five seats in the 2026 midterms. items.title: Texas congressional map approved amid partisan fight
items.standfirst: Texas state representatives approved a new congressional map aimed at giving Republicans five more House seats, following a request from President Donald Trump. Democrats tried to block the vote by leaving the state but returned and were defeated 88–52; the bill now moves to the Texas Senate, with Democrats hoping for a court challenge.
items.content: Texas state representatives approved a new congressional map aimed at giving Republicans five more House seats, following a request from President Donald Trump. Democrats tried to block the vote by leaving the state but returned and were defeated 88–52; the bill now moves to the Texas Senate, with Democrats hoping for a court challenge.

items.title: Texas lawmakers approve congressional maps favoring Republicans
items.standfirst: Texas Republicans advanced new congressional maps on Wednesday that could secure the party up to five additional US House seats. The proposed districts, urged by President Donald Trump to boost GOP midterm chances, must now pass the state Senate and be signed by Governor Abbott to become law.
items.content: Texas Republicans advanced new congressional maps on Wednesday that could secure the party up to five additional US House seats. The proposed districts, urged by President Donald Trump to boost GOP midterm chances, must now pass the state Senate and be signed by Governor Abbott to become law.

items.title: Sony’s PlayStation Gets $50 US Price Hike, Joining Rivals
items.standfirst: Sony Group Corp. will raise the price of its popular PlayStation 5 video-game console to $550 from $500 in the US, following rival console-makers Microsoft Corp. and Nintendo Co. in price hikes after tariffs increased the cost of imports.
items.content: Sony Group Corp. will raise the price of its popular PlayStation 5 video-game console to $550 from $500 in the US, following rival console-makers Microsoft Corp. and Nintendo Co. in price hikes after tariffs increased the cost of imports.

ai_summary: Sony is raising the price of the PlayStation 5 in the U.S.
The price increase is $50, bringing the total to $550.
Sony cited the challenging economic environment as the reason.
Microsoft and Nintendo previously increased console prices.
The price hike follows increased import costs due to tariffs.

clusters.title: At least 78 people killed as bus collides with fuel truck in western Afghanistan
clusters.neutral_headline: Bus Crash in Afghanistan Kills Over Seventy People

items.title: At least 78 people killed as bus collides with fuel truck in western Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Children among dead after bus carrying Afghans deported from Iran crashed and caught fire in Herat province Seventy-eight people have died in western Afghanistan in a collision between a bus carrying Afghans who had recently been deported from Iran and two other vehicles.The bus hit a motorcycle and a truck transporting fuel on Tuesday night, causing an explosive fire in Guzara district, Herat province. Two of the three survivors later died of their injuries, officials said on Wednesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Children among dead after bus carrying Afghans deported from Iran crashed and caught fire in Herat province Seventy-eight people have died in western Afghanistan in a collision between a bus carrying Afghans who had recently been deported from Iran and two other vehicles.The bus hit a motorcycle and a truck transporting fuel on Tuesday night, causing an explosive fire in Guzara district, Herat province. Two of the three survivors later died of their injuries, officials said on Wednesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Bus crash kills more than 70 Afghans deported from Iran, including 17 children
items.standfirst: At least 75 people, including 17 children, have been killed in Afghanistan in a traffic accident involving a bus carrying migrants who were deported from Iran, officials said Wednesday.
items.content: At least 75 people, including 17 children, have been killed in Afghanistan in a traffic accident involving a bus carrying migrants who were deported from Iran, officials said Wednesday.

ai_summary: A bus crash in Afghanistan killed over seventy people.
The bus was carrying Afghans deported from Iran.
Seventeen children were among the fatalities.
The crash involved a fuel truck and a motorcycle.
The accident occurred in Herat province, causing a fire.

clusters.title: Family's plea to fugitive dad on the run with children for nearly four years
clusters.neutral_headline: Family Appeals for Fugitive Father to Return with Children

items.title: Family's plea to fugitive dad on the run with children for nearly four years
items.standfirst: The family of a father who disappeared with his three children nearly four years ago in New Zealand have broken their silence to appeal for him to return home.
items.content: The family of a father who disappeared with his three children nearly four years ago in New Zealand have broken their silence to appeal for him to return home.

items.title: Family of NZ fugitive on the run with children pleads for return
items.standfirst: Tom Phillips and his children have been missing since 2021, in a case that has gripped New Zealand.
items.content: Tom Phillips and his children have been missing since 2021, in a case that has gripped New Zealand.

ai_summary: A family is pleading for a father to return home.
The father disappeared with his three children in New Zealand.
The family has broken their silence after nearly four years.
The case has captured significant attention in New Zealand.
The family hopes for the safe return of the children.
